item.title: [Dupe] #3 "The Lone Ranger"
item.dc:creator: @iz3_legend iz3 legend
item.description:
@iz3_legend wrote:

  1. Your statically accessing a class which should never have anything to-do with static context.

  2. Why do you have a parameter that does absolutely nothing?

  3. 95% of the conventions in this code are wrong.

  4. } else (Player.hasarrows < 1) { Enough said.

  5. "Don't forget to buy spins @ your local runescape!" Getting a third grade education would fix this.

  6. Range.RangeAttack();… Really?

  7. } else (Player.hasarrows < 1) { So if the player has less than one arrow we’re good to go?

  8. Whilst right before player click on npc or player reads combat. A third grade education would fix this too.

Read full topic

item.title: [Dupe] #3 "The Lone Ranger"
item.dc:creator: @Driman_Rune Driman Rune
item.description:
@Driman_Rune wrote:

Explanations:

So this is basically is in almost all 317 PI, that when you switch any weapon to range it doesn’t check your arrows or bolts. Or if your switching ranging weapons. Please note this isn’t the fix for the (317 PI Range Glitch), where it doesn’t read the method right and you can shoot bows with bolts.

item.title: [Dupe] #3 "The Lone Ranger"
item.dc:creator: @Driman_Rune Driman Rune
item.description:
@Driman_Rune wrote:

[code=java]
Player.readCombat(true);

/*

  • Whilst right before player click on npc or player reads combat.
    */
    public void readCombat(boolean b) {
    if(Player.rangeCombat) {
    checkInventory(true);
    } else {
    /TODO with the combat Triangle/
    //checkInventory(true);
    }
    }

/*
*Reads the inventory.
*/
public void checkInventory(boolean b) {
if(Player.hasarrows <= 0) {
Player.startAnim(65535);
Player.readDialogues().sendGameMessage(“You have no arrows! Don’t forget to buy spins @ your local runescape!”);
return;
} else (Player.hasarrows < 1) {
Range.RangeAttack();
}
}

My Dupe #3 Fix!

  • Special thanks to (Lone Ranger of Rs) showed me on a rsps how it worked, and I fixed it ^.^.[/code]
